Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2012 06:50AM RealtorJackie wrote:   I have sarcoid, and very sensitive skin.  My skin never opened up.  I aired the skin each day, and used Aquafor liberally.  I only wore a loose cotten bra when i had to, and wore a soft cotten cami against my skin, putting the bro OVER it.
Posts.Title: A rad onc weighs in on radiation "burns" Spinnerpom 53nancy

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2012 06:49PM RealtorJackie wrote:    I had a lumpectomy with my nipple and areola removed.  The surgeon felt the cancer was setting up close to my nipple.  I lost about 1/4-1/3 of my breast.  It is smooth, and I still have feeling in it.  I am large busted(44 DD), and do not wear a prothesis.  During the surgery, they found cancer in my lymph nodes(15/23).  If I had known this prior to surgery, I may have opted for an MX.  I just had a mammo 3 wks ago which was abnormal.  I had to have another biopsy--which was negative.  It was just necrotic fat tissue.  I am 51.
Posts.Title: Help! Lumpectomy taking the nipple. kem510 Worriedsickinpa

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2010 12:59PM RealtorJackie wrote: The saga goes on...I went to the surgeon, and he said the hematoma opened a new hole next to the incision.  He took the back of the q-tip, and made the hole bigger.  It is draining periodically. I have to wear a maxi-pad in my bra.  I am on an antibiotic.
Posts.Title: Hematoma RealtorJackie BarbaraA

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 01:14PM RealtorJackie wrote: The hematoma started out the size of a nickel next to my incision.  It just looked like a second bruise, and was hard.  The doctor said that it was a hematoma, and it would take a couple of weeks to go down.  It wasn't too painful at that time.  Then it burst during the night, and opened up the corner of my incision, and started bleeding--and hurts like hell!
Posts.Title: Hematoma RealtorJackie BarbaraA

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2010 06:41PM RealtorJackie wrote:   I had a 2 cm. tumor, and 15/23 nodes positive.  My mammograms were clear for 10 years prior, the last one was 11 months before I found a "thickening" in my breast.
Posts.Title: Tumor Size in Stage III peverson Leslie1962

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 08:49PM RealtorJackie wrote: When we told out 2 daughters, 16 and 19, that my cancer had progressed to stage IV, it was difficult.  We were honest with them.  It was a week before Christmas, and had waited until the oldest came home from college. Unfortunately, her world shattered.  Within 2 weeks she was hospitalized with a diagnosis of bipolar illness.  She has been hospitalized 2 more times since then, and every day is a struggle for her.  Apparently, she had a predisposition to it, but the doctors are saying the strain of my cancer has brought it on.
Posts.Title: How do you tell them (long post)? reesie reesie

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2011 09:41PM RealtorJackie wrote: EYELASHES!  I finished 6 rounds of A/C on Feb. 23.  My eyelashes are starting to grow, but one eye the lashes are growing downward.  I had to go to the doctor last week, and have several rows PULLED OUT!  They brush against my cornea, and the pain is very bad.  Has anyone had this experience, and how did they deal with it?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2011 08:59PM RealtorJackie wrote:   The first error I didn't know for days.  I was supposed to be having day surgery, and woke up on a respirator in intensive care.  My husband got my medical records before I left that hospital, and found the second error with the artery,    I don't watch HOUSE,so I don't know.
Posts.Title: Surgery Tomorrow RealtorJackie Leah_S

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 01:29PM RealtorJackie wrote:   I just wanted to let you know that I had my port placed on Tuesday.  The surgeon called the port placement from hell.  They ended up in my jugular.  I had my first chemo yesterday and neulasta today.  I am holding up!!!  Keep me in your thoughts and prayers!
Posts.Title: I'm In the Club RealtorJackie Maureen813

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2010 10:03PM RealtorJackie wrote:   I had the chemo and neulasta.  I am feeling queasy on/off.  They gave me compazine.  It works, but nocks me out.  Feeling achy. I took tylenol arthritis because I thought the advil would irritate my tummy.  Keep me in your prayers.  This is so scary.  I am waiting for the results of my PET scan.  They couldn't get all the cancer from my nodes during surgery.  I have 2 beautiful teen daughters, and a wonderful husband I need to live for.  This is what is keeps me going.
Posts.Title: I'm In the Club RealtorJackie Maureen813

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2011 08:46PM RealtorJackie wrote:   I know it has been a long time since I have posted.  Unfortunately, my surgeon completely botched my biopsy.  When he pulled out the scope, the blade was not fully retracted.  He cut a vein in my throat, and I started bleeding to death.    To save my life, he cut through my chest, but while doing so, he cut an artery next to my heart.  My vocal cord is also paralyzed.  I was in intensive care, then regular care, then a nursing home.  I developed a blood clot in my lung, and spent 2 more weeks in another hospital.  I had a pleural effusion, and afib episodes.      BIOPSY WAS NEGATIVE!!  I have Sarcoidosis--an auto-immune disease!
Posts.Title: Surgery Tomorrow RealtorJackie Leah_S

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2012 06:42PM RealtorJackie wrote:     I was a very unusual case.  I finished chemo 2/11, and didn't start rads until 11/11.  My original onc thought I had progressed to stage 4, because of a misread PET scan.  He wrote off the rest of my treatment(which should have been rads).  I had a 2nd opinion on my cancer, and found out that I was stage 3.  The concensus was that I should have rads anyway.
Posts.Title: Waiting a month for Rads..anyone else wait? kelleysgroi financegirl
